But we want all children back in school.Professor Neil Ferguson, whose modelling led to the decision to impose the lockdown, suggested ministers would need to ldquorow back on the relaxation of restrictions, such as in social and leisure venues and with increased working from home, to allow a full-timeto schools. colleges, link lots of households together, reconnect the social network which social distancing measures have deliberately disconnected" data-source"Professor Neil Ferguson"He told Today: ldquoI mean that really is a policy decision, but Irsquom just saying, in my view, it is likely that some form of those measures will be necessary to maintain control of transmission.Prof Ferguson, whose advice continues to inform the Governmentrsquos response despite his resignation from the Sage advisory group, said there is some evidence that older teenagers transmit the virus just as effectively as adults.ldquoThe risk then is that big schools, comprehensives, universities, FEcolleges, link lots of households together, reconnect the social network which social distancing measures have deliberately disconnected. And that poses a real risk of amplication of transmission, of case numbers going up quite sharply, he said.Ms Longfield had earlier accused the Government of treating children ldquoas an afterthought during the Covid- crisis.In a briefing paper, she said keeping schools open should be the ldquoabsolute priority, adding: ldquoEducation should be prioritised over other sectors: first to open, last to close.ldquoWhen only a limited amount of social interaction is feasible, the amount accounted for by education must be protected ndash at the expense of other sectors activities.Labour was unequivocal in backing Ms Longfieldrsquos demand, with leader Sir Keir Starmer warning Mr Johnson he has only a month to fix the test and trace programme to prevent a resurgence in outbreaks. vw,vw,px, px"ldquoWe were promised a world-beating system, we havenrsquot got it. So wersquore saying to the Government very clearly today, time is running out, Sir Keir said during a visit to Stoke.ldquoSchools must be the priority and we certainly support the call that schools should be the last to close.In Scotland, First Minister Nicola Sturgeon appeared to take action to prioritise schools when she ordered bars, cafes and restaurants to close in Aberdeen as an outbreak of  new cases prompted ato lockdown restrictions.ldquoActing now, we judge, gives us the time and the space to protect the ability of our young people toto education, she said.Meanwhile, an influential cross-party committee of MPs blamed the Governmentrsquos earlier failure to quarantine travellers arriving in the UK for having ldquoaccelerated the spread of Covid-.The report by the Commons Home Affairs Committee was scathing of the ldquoinexplicable decision to lt all border restrictions in March, which they say led to ldquomany more people contracting Covid-.Figures published by the UKrsquos statistics agencies show there have now been , deaths registered in the UK where Covid- was mentioned on the death certicate..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Government says it cannot order schools to stay open during local lockdowns article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log -- s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: john hume made peace visible darkest moments
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMourners heard that the former SDLP leader and Nobel laureate saved the lives of others through his vision and work.During his funeral at St Eugenersquos Cathedral in Londonderry, Mr Hume was described as a man who made his family ldquolaugh, dream and think.Father Paul Farren said that Mr Hume gave his le for his country.He said: ldquoHe focused on unity and peace, and giving that dignity to every person.ldquoWe should never underestimate how dficult it was for John to cross the road and do what was intensely unpopular for the greater good. vw,vw,px, px"SDLP leader Colum Eastwood and Taoiseach Micheal Martin arrive at St Eugenersquos Cathedral ldquoEven in the darkest moments, when people would have been forgiven for having no hope, John made peace visible for others.ldquoHis vision revealed what could be, and with time and determination and single-mindedness and stubbornness, he convinced others that peace could be a reality.In his homily he said that Mr Hume never lost faith in peace, nor faith in his ability to convince others that peace was the only way.ldquoIf ever you want to see a man who gave his le for his country, and his health, that man is John Hume. The world knows it, he added. vw,vw,px, px"John Hume Junior speaks at his fatherrsquos funeral Father Farren said that John and his we Pat have secured their place in the history of Ireland, ldquoJohn being Irelandrsquos greatest.Mr Humersquos son John Hume Junior told those gathered in the Cathedral that his dadwas a Derryman to his core.Mr Hume added: ldquoIf dad were here today, in the fullness of his health, witnessing the current tensions in the world, he wouldnrsquot waste the opportunity to say a few words.ldquoHersquod talk about our common humanity, the need to respect ersity and dference, to protect and deepen democracy, to value education, and to place non-violence at the absolute centre.Thanks to everyone who has lit a candle for peace this evening in memory of John. #JohnsLight pic chiylbnPGSmdash Social Democratic and Labour PartyAugust , ldquoHe might also stress the right to a living wage and a roof over your head, to decent healthcare and education.ldquoMarrying Pat, our mother, was without a doubt dadrsquos greatest achievement and she enabled him to reach his full potential.ldquoAlong with mum, he taught us all our values and gave us all our moral compass. And for that we will be forever in their debt.Messages were also read from former US president Bill Clinton, Prime Minister Boris Johnson and U singer Bono. vw,vw,px, px"Northern Irelandrsquos First Minister Arlene Foster Among the dignitaries were Irelandrsquos President Michael D Higgins, Taoiseach Micheal Martin, Northern Irelandrsquos First Minister Arlene Foster and Deputy First Minister Michelle OrsquoNeill.Others included former SDLP leader Mark Durkan and current leader Colum Eastwood.Mr Durkan and Mr Humersquos eldest daughter Therese led the readings while singer Anne Marie Hickey was joined by organist Aidan Watkins and Frank Gallagher, who played the violin.Prayers of the faithful were read by Mr Humersquos grandchildren Dee, Aoibhe, Rachel and Una.A poem written by Aidan Hume, Mr Humersquos son, was read by Mo Hume. vw,vw,px, px"Frank Gallagher plays the violin during the service Aidan, who is based in Boston, was not able to attend the funeral because of Covid- travel restrictions.Mo became tearful as she read her siblingrsquos tribute to her father.ldquoYou made us realise a border is just a line on a map. Itrsquos in our hearts and minds where we need to bridge the gap, she said.ldquoThorough over  years of violence, hurt and unrelenting stress, those underlying conditions you never stopped trying to address.ldquoI donrsquot think I ever said aloud how you made us all so incredibly proud. All you ever wanted was to make the world a better place. vw,vw,px, px"John Hume died on Monday Pope Francis also paid tribute to Mr Hume.A statement from the Vatican said: ldquoHis Holiness Pope Francis was saddened to learn of the death of John Hume, and sends the assurance of his prayers to his family and to all who mourn his loss.ldquoMindful of the Christian faith that inspired John Humersquos untiring efforts to promote dialogue, reconciliation and peace among the people of Northern Ireland, his Holiness commends his noble soul to the loving mercy of Almighty God.A message from the Dalai Lama was also read during the service.ldquoI was pleased to be able to meet John during one of my several visits to Northern Ireland, he said. vw,vw,px, px"President Michael D Higgins arrives for the funeral ldquoIndeed, his deep conviction in the power of dialogue and negotiations in resolving the problem in his homeland has been an example of non-violent resolution of issues.ldquoIt was his leadership and his faith in the power ofnegotiations that enabled the  Good Friday Agreement to be reached. His steady persistence set an example for all of us to follow.ldquoAlthough my fellow Nobel laureate is no longer with us, his message about peace and non-violence in the resolution of conflict, no matter how protracted or dficult it may seem to be, will long survive him. He lived a truly meaningful le.Derry musician Phil Coulter played Mr Humersquos favourite song The Town I Loved So Well on the piano at the end of the service.Speaking before the funeral, Mr Eastwood said they were grateful to have had Mr Hume. vw,vw,px, px"Father Paul Farren ldquoThere is work to be done and John was always forward thinking. He gave us the , he gave us the pathway, he gave us the opportunity to do this free from violence, he said.ldquoWe have to keep going to build the shared island that we want.Mrs Foster described it as a ldquosad day.ldquoI was reflecting that this has been a very dficult year for the SDLP with the loss of John Dallat and Seamus Mallon. We are here to support colleagues and indeed the family.Ms OrsquoNeill said that Mr Humersquos death marks the start of the end of an era.ldquoThe era of Martin McGuinness, John Hume, Ian Paisley ndash all dferent political perspectives, she added.ldquoBut as we lose big giants like that there is a huge onus on us, as the post-Good Friday Agreement generation of political leaders, to be able to carry out the good work they started.People lined the streets outside the Cathedral and applauded as the funeral procession made its way along the route to the city cemetery where a private burial took place.Following a request from John Humes family, President Higgins and Sabina this evening lit a "candle for peace" at Aacuteras an Uachtaraacutein. pic GPZhkfRkpmdash President of IrelandAugust , Mrs Hume and her family acknowledged the crowds through the open car windows.The Derry politician, feted around the world as a peacemaker, died on Monday at the age of  after a long battle with dementia.In ordinary circumstances, Mr Humersquos funeral would have been expected to draw huge crowds, but numbers were limited due to coronavirus restrictions.Mr Hume was a key architect of the Good Friday Agreement and was awarded the Nobel peace prize for the pivotal role he played in ending the regionrsquos sectarian conflict.The former MP, Stormont Assembly member and MEP, led the party he helped found for  years. vw,vw,px, px"Northern Irelandrsquos Deputy First Minister Michelle OrsquoNeill arrives at St Eugenersquos Cathedral He was a prominent figure in the civil rights campaigns of the late s and also played a leading role in the formation of the credit union movement.Throughout his political career, he remained steadfast in his commitment to non-violence.His participation in secret talks with then Sinn Fein president Gerry Adams in the late s and early s was a key catalyst for the nascent peace process.The SDLP leader faced intense criticism, including some from within his own party, when his dialogue with Mr Adams became public in .Despite threats to his le, he persisted with his efforts to engage with the republican movement and to convince the IRA to end its campaign of violence. vw,vw,px, px"Pat Hume is embraced by family members as Mr Hume is taken into St Eugenersquos Cathedral The highlight of Mr Humersquos career came in  with the signing of the historic Good Friday accord which largely ended Northern Irelandrsquos -year sectarian conflict.Along with Ulster Unionist Party leader David Trimble, now Lord Trimble, Mr Hume was awarded the Nobel peace prize for his contribution to stopping the bloodshed.In , Mr Hume was named ldquoIrelandrsquos Greatest in a poll by Irelandrsquos national broadcaster RTE.His death came just six months after that of fellow Good Friday architect and long-time SDLP deputy leader Seamus Mallon.A number of vehicles were hijacked in Derry on Tuesday afternoon, with Mr Eastwood accusing those responsible of violating the grief of the city..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: John Hume  umade peace visible during darkest moments u article_url   content_id   site_id title: autumn date set opening new south lake leisure centre
story: Air ambulance takes motorcyclist to hospital after serious RTCSadness as funeral of popular Co Armagh woman takes place todayNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsPeopleAutumn date set for opening of new South Lake Leisure CentreA date has been set for the opening of the new south lake leisure centre in Craigavon with the multi-million-pound facility to open its doors on November .By The NewsroomTuesday, th July , : pmUpdated Tuesday, th July , : pm""The largest capital project to date undertaken by ABC Council, and among the largest in Northern Ireland, the new multi-use sports and leisure complex is described by the council as a major new flagship health and wellbeing destination.Work on the facility was halted by the coronavirus outbreak. Since ing to site Farrans, the contractor in charge of the build, has ensured the contract is completed ready for opening in the Autumn.Farrans has been spearheading the build since initial enabling works got under way early in , creating  jobs on site during construction as part of a project which has delivered at least £. million in direct wages to the local economy.Located at the south side of Craigavon’s balancing lake, the facility is a landmark venue for the area and is situated within a pre-existing network of walking and cycling paths covering around three miles. The council hopes the new leisure centre will welcome visitors from across the borough and beyond to its new -metre pool, a young children’s indoor leisure water feature, a ,m state-of-the-art gym, multiple studios, health and wellbeing suite, sensory room, eight-court sports halls, spin studio, soft play area and an on-site café.It also incorporates an outdoor water sports provision offering a wide range of water based activities including windsurfing, water skiing and paddle sports. The council says the scale of South Lake Leisure Centre has been future-proofed to meet the needs of a growing population and a raising demand from a range of leisure, amateur and professional sporting enthusiasts.Lord Mayor of Armagh City, Banbridge and Craigavon, Councillor Kevin Savage, sai: “With a confirmed opening date just  weeks away, I am delighted that this stunning new centre - which will have fabulous facilities for everyone in the borough to access and enjoy - is almost complete.“South Lake Leisure Centre provides a once-in-a-generation opportunity to transform and dramatically enhance the quality of health and leisure provision within the borough, providing community access for everyone to the best facilities available in the UK and Ireland.”As part of the preparations for the official opening of South Lake Leisure Centre, interim arrangements have been agreed for leisure facilities in Portadownand Brownlow . Cascades Leisure Complex will be open to the public for lane swimming only in August, remaining open until Saturday th October.Craigavon Leisure Centre will remain open to the public for gym only until Monday th October. Waves Leisure Complex will be closed to the public.When all these facilities, which are approaching the end of their al le close, leisure staff will begin their training at the new South Lake Leisure Centre building.""Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us onExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryLocal GuideReader ShopUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter" fill"#ea"©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-gxMtzJ sc-dfVpRl dLpuYr"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyNews you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""""" scale translate " points"  .  . title: lockdown blues  year old vera lifted call daniel odonnell
story: NI man is finalist in ‘Shed of the Year’Police uncover £, worth of Class A and B drugsNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoLestyleCarsHomes and GardensNewsPeopleLockdown blues of -year-old Vera lted by call from Daniel O’DonnellA -year-old lady from Portadown was thrilled to receive a video message from her favourite singer, Daniel O’Donnell, during lockdown.By Helen McGurkTuesday, th August , : pmUpdated Tuesday, th August , : pm""Vera recceiving her call from Daniel ODonnellVera Purdy, who receives home care from Home Instead Senior Care Banbridge, confided in her caregiver about feeling isolated during the nationwide lockdown, which has prevented her from seeing friends and family.Vera’s caregiver knew that she enjoyed listening to Daniel O’Donnell, so set about with the rest of the Home Instead team to try and get in touch with him.They contacted his management team and told them all about how Vera was Daniel’s biggest fan, having gone to see him at many of his concerts over the years. Daniel recorded a -minute personalised video message for Vera and sent it over to the Home Instead care team. He remembered meeting Vera many years ago, and even remembered her late husband and mother’s names. He also recalled Vera and her family coming to watch him at his concerts and entertaining the family at her mother’s th birthday party.Vera was delighted with the video message. Her caregiver recorded her reaction as she watched the video, and her face lit up. She has watched the video over and over, and has happily ed back to her normal, positive self. Vera said: “It has given me such a boost.”But more was to follow. As pleased as Vera was with the video message, she was even more delighted when she received a call from Daniel himself on the following Sunday evening. He called for a chat with Vera to reminisce about the past and expressed how pleased he was hear from Home Instead.He said he was impressed how Home Instead had gone above and beyond to ensure her happiness.Roisin McLeod, care manager at Home Instead Banbridge, said: “It was great to see Vera so happy and joyful.“Although we are regular visitors of our clients, lockdown has still been tough for many. “Gestures of kindness such as the video message from Daniel are massively appreciated and help remind our older generation that they aren’t alone during these uncertain times.”""Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"Most Popular." data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" data-s-el"" title"" class"sc-drMfKT fpqScQ"" alt"" layout"fill"" data-index"" data-s-event"gaEvent" data-s-ec"navigation" data-s-ea"most popular" title"" data-s-el"" class"sc-bGbJRg eOOfIS"This website and its associated newspaper are members of Independent Press Standards Organisation Follow us onExploreNewsSportWhats OnLestyleMore from Portadown TimesAnnouncementsJobsPublic NoticesMust ReadBuy a PhotoDirectoryLocal GuideReader ShopUseful LinksContact UsAdvertise My BusinessAdvertise a JobPlace your AdSubscribeEventsArchiveReaders Charter" fill"#ea"©JPIMedia Publishing Ltd. ." target"_self" href"#" id"cookieSettings" class"sc-gxMtzJ sc-dfVpRl dLpuYr"Cookie SettingsTerms and ConditionsPrivacy policyNews you can trust since News" class"expand" role"button" tabindex""""" scale translate " points"  .  .
